meanings.sent1: She externalised her thoughts by writing them down.
meanings.sent2: The company externalised its customer service to a call center.
meanings.sent3: He externalised his excitement by jumping up and down.
meanings.sent4: The artist externalised her emotions onto the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The child externalised his imagination through his drawings.

meanings.definition: To attribute to an external source or cause.
meanings.sent1: The scientist externalised the discovery to years of research.
meanings.sent2: She externalised her success to the support of her family.
meanings.sent3: He externalised his clumsiness to the slippery floor.
meanings.sent4: The author externalised the inspiration to a dream she had.
meanings.sent5: The athlete externalised his strength to his daily training.
